newsitem.title: USA: America Online unit, Nynex in pact.
newsitem.headline: America Online unit, Nynex in pact.

text.p: America Online Inc.'s network service unit ANS Communications Inc. said Tuesday it agreed to a comprehensive relationship with Nynex Corp. to develop and market intranet and extranets.
Intranets are internal corporate networks designed along Internet standards. Extranets are private, Internet-based networks that connect a company to suppliers and customers.
Nynex will resell existing ANS services, while ANS will support intranet and extranet connections to Nynex business customers over the ANSnet Internet backbone network.

As part of the alliance, Nynex will develop a customised global extranet for financial services companies through partnerships with ANS, Sun Microsystems Inc. and Avesta. The system will be marketed through Nynex.
Nynex announced its planned entry into the intranet/extranet market at the Securities Industry Association Information Management Conference in New York Tuesday.
AOL's stock fell 25 cents to $58.50, while Nynex edged down 37.5 cents to $56.50 on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon trading.
